author: Special Correspondent
text:
The cadre of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) and members of the organisations affiliated to it paid tributes to the memory of the 22 party workers who were killed during police action inside Salem Central Prison, on the memorial day on Thursday.

The 22 party men who were lodged in the Salem Central Prison were protesting against the ill-treatment meted out to them by the prison authorities, when the prison police opened fire to quell the mob on February 11, 1950. While 17 prisoners were killed in police firing, five more died due to police action.

P. Thangavel, district secretary of the CPI (M), hoisted the party flag in the martyrs memorial flag moist outside the Central Prison. He explained the police action on the innocent prisoners and said that the sacrifice made by the partymen will be ever remembered.

K. Jothilakshmi, State secretary of the All India Democratic Women’s Association (AIDWA), N. Praveen Kumar, district secretary of the Democratic Youth Federation of India (DYFI), M. Murugesan, city secretary of the CPI (M) and others spoke highlighting the sacrifice made by the martyrs. They urged the government to set up a memorial for the martyrs outside the premises campus, a demand pending for many years.
title: Martyrs remembered
